text: well the first thing you have to do is
you have to think
counterintuitively uh if you're simply
going to do what everyone else does by
definition you're going to end up being
I think
mediocre uh but following the pack um
and so the first thing is a
mindset uh that encourages you that
enables you to encourage people who are
working with you or for you uh to think
in a kind of counter cyclical or
counterintuitive way it's one of the
things that I've admired the most about
Mike Bloomberg who just it's in his DNA
and therefore in the DNA of Bloomberg
the company to do what other people
don't do I think about it he formed the
company in the midst of the last Great
Recession in the early 80s expanded the
company dramatically by opening up a
news Operation expanding internationally
moving from fixed income into equities
in the recession of the late 1980s and
early 1990s saw the biggest gains by
investing heavily in product and product
development in the recession in the
early part of this decade and that's
fundamentally what we are doing uh today
at Bloomberg we're actually adding
almost a thousand people this year to
build build out new product to start new
businesses to build our news
organization because we fundamentally
believe that things will come back we I
can't tell you exactly when and we want
to be positioned um for when they do for
us this is a market share gain period
and the only way to do that is to be
aggressive in providing better products
better service uh and um really
recruiting the kinds of people are going
to lead us forward that's what we use as
period and that's the same approach that
we took in the city you know as I said
we came in um in early 2002 the economy
was reeling and we learned the lessons
from the 1970s the 1970s in New York
were disastrous decade we lost 800,000
people as we disinvested in quality of
life police protection our mass transit
system our Parks our schools and people
fled taking their taxes with them and it
took the City a generation to recover
the 800,000 people that it lost during
that decade when we came into office the
mayor concluded we were not going to do
the same thing that in fact what we had
to do was preserve the quality of life
enhance it while still being prudent
about the way we spent money but more
importantly making the
Investments that would Propel the next
stage of growth when the recovery
occurred and the recovery always does
occur history is perfect now in each one
of these downturns people said New York
will never recover 10 times out of 10
New York came back stronger than ever
and so at the depth of the financial
crisis the last one we actually
announced the largest affordable housing
program ever by a city in American
history to build out neighborhoods that
we thought had the chance for Real
Recovery we invested heavily in
infrastructure and in in our education
system and the city has continued to
grow the tax base has continued to grow
we generated surpluses through the good
times part of which have been used to
cushion us through the bad times but
fundamentally what it is is that
counterintuitive counter cyclical
thinking
